distributional 0.3.2
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Sampling distribution

Source: R/dist_sample.R
dist_sample.Rd

dist_sample(x)

Arguments

x

A list of sampled values.

Examples

# Univariate numeric samples
dist <- dist_sample(x = list(rnorm(100), rnorm(100, 10)))

dist
#> <distribution[2]>
#> [1] sample[100] sample[100]
mean(dist)
#> [1] -0.02804721 10.02714541
variance(dist)
#> [1] 1.188260 0.995824
skewness(dist)
#> [1] -0.08471805  0.02253927
generate(dist, 10)
#> [[1]]
#>  [1]  0.93238168 -0.49524548 -1.28311385  0.44762830 -1.20600613  1.22333970
#>  [7] -0.04303454 -0.78933127 -0.54128907  0.35915417
#> 
#> [[2]]
#>  [1]  9.639980  9.845266 10.338692  9.760783 11.380217  9.639980  9.448603
#>  [8] 10.253142 10.160722 10.571433
#> 

density(dist, 1)
#> [1] 0.2739379 0.0000000

# Multivariate numeric samples
dist <- dist_sample(x = list(cbind(rnorm(100), rnorm(100, 10))))

dist
#> <distribution[1]>
#> [1] sample[100]
mean(dist)
#> [1] -0.1063562  9.9543357
variance(dist)
#>            [,1]       [,2]
#> [1,] 1.06354407 0.04194195
#> [2,] 0.04194195 0.85362167
skewness(dist)
#> [1] -0.0110823
generate(dist, 10)
#> [[1]]
#>             [,1]      [,2]
#>  [1,] -2.1788359  8.008424
#>  [2,]  2.0604752 10.732786
#>  [3,]  0.2645207 10.765149
#>  [4,]  0.2645207 10.765149
#>  [5,] -1.0940393  8.779726
#>  [6,]  0.2645207 10.765149
#>  [7,] -1.0940393  8.779726
#>  [8,]  0.3925543  8.844091
#>  [9,] -0.5876966 10.288386
#> [10,]  0.8562148 10.404437
#> 

density(dist, 1)
#> [1] 0.2426352 0.0000000
